tossup_question: 23) MATH  Linear correlation coefficients must lie between what two values?
bonus_question: 24) MATH  Which of the following is NOT true?
bonus_MCQoptions:
W) A rational function’s graph may intersect its horizontal asymptote
 X) A rational function’s graph may intersect one of its vertical asymptotes 
Y) The function f(x) = -1/x is its own inverse 
Z) The function f(x) = -x is its own inverse
bonus_answer: ANSWER: X) A RATIONAL FUNCTION’S GRAPH MAY INTERSECT ONE OF ITS VERTICAL ASYMPTOTES
